ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the second blast follows it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and will be followed by another quaking.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and will be followed by the second one,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the following event will come after it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What must happen afterwards shall follow it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and the second blast follows it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And there will follow it the next blast.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and is followed by the Successor,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The second blowing of the Trumpet follows it (and everybody will be raised up),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And is followed by the Successor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: There will follow it the subsequent [one].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:7] and is followed by the Aftershock, the second blast; between the two [blasts] is a span of forty years (the sentence [tatba‘uhā’l-rādifatu] is a circumstantial qualifier referring to al-rājifa, ‘the Tremor’, in other words, the ‘day’ can [adverbially] accommodate both blasts and other events, and so for this reason it can also properly function as the adverbial qualifier for the Resurrection that will take place after the second [blast]);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the second followeth it) this is the final blowing on the trumpet,
